Wed., Sept 27: Be there with us for the moments that drive change.
  


ACLU Freedom Agenda Lobby Day

Wed., Sept. 27, 9:30 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Massachusetts State House
24 Beacon Street
Boston, MA 02133

RSVP TODAY
Share this:           

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

I'm Olivia Santoro, volunteer coordinator for the ACLU of Massachusetts. In my job, I have the privilege of being present for the moments when people find their voice and the courage to speak up about the issues they care about. It is the people power built in these moments that drives change. One of these moments happened at the State House in June when ACLU supporters, like you, showed up to support immigrants' rights.

Among the hundreds of people who gathered that day was Ian, a 21-year-old ACLU volunteer. Ian said:

"Going to the State House showed me that I can make a difference. I discovered that I could just walk into my legislator's office and advocate for the issues I care about. You don’t have to be an expert! You just have to be passionate. If we take that passion and turn it into action, I know there is a lot we can accomplish."

That's what lobby visits are all about. Lobby visits are meetings with our legislators to show that their constituents are willing to turn their passion into action. And, just as Ian said, you don't have to be an expert to do it!

We're just one week away from the ACLU Lobby Day! On Wednesday, September 27, we are heading to the State House to make our voices heard. Be there with us for the moments that drive change.

ACLU Freedom Agenda Lobby Day
Wednesday, September 27, 9:30 a.m. – 2 p.m.
Massachusetts State House
24 Beacon Street
Boston, MA 02133
RSVP

Whether this is your first time heading to the State House or you are on a first name basis with your legislator, there is a place for you at the ACLU Freedom Agenda Lobby Day.

We will have an on-site training and materials available, and you can check out our short training video in advance, Preparing for Your Lobby Visit.

In solidarity,

Olivia Santoro
Volunteer Coordinator
ACLU of Massachusetts
